title: iPhone Touch Sensing Architect
summary: The goal of the iPhone Touch Sensing Technology team is to enable the world’s best User Experiences through state-of-the-art sensing solutions. The team designs, develops, and delivers high-precision, low-latency MultiTouch solutions that are the gold standard in the smartphone/mobile industries...
description: You will play a key role in the architecture, integration, and launch of next-generation touch sensing technologies. Your responsibilities will include: Develop key figures of merit critical to performance and author requirement specifications, Develop end-to-end models capturing sensor, circuits, DSP, and algorithms to predict key figures of merit and inform technical decisions, Develop tools, scripts, and infrastructure to enable scalable modeling, Sensor design, ASIC application design, system-level integration and bring-up, Analyze and reconcile build data with model predictions, Perform failure analysis, identify root causes and propose corrective actions, Provide clear technical updates to broader team and leadership
key_qualifications: Deep understanding of physics, analog circuits, linear algebra. Experience in modeling, building and testing complex, multi-physics systems, Proficiency in MATLAB, SPICE, COMSOL or similar packages, Hands-on experience in system-level design, architecture, characterization and validation, Ability to thrive in ambiguity, independently converge technical issues, and align efforts across teams, Excellent communication, teamwork, and leadership skills, Experience with high-volume mass production is a plus.
education_experience: BS and a minimum of 10 years relevant industry experience
pay_benefits: At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $166,600 and $296,300, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location...
